other_tests.findings: Numerous nonspecific focal lesions (≤8 mm in diameter) throughout the periventricular and corona radiata white matter that did not show enhancement after gadolinium administration.
Heterogeneously hypoechoic parenchymal nodules (≤1 cm in diameter) with no dominant mass, appearance reminiscent of macronodular cirrhosis.
Patent portal vein with normal waveforms and flow velocity.
Heterogeneous hepatic parenchymal enhancement confirmed splenomegaly without evidence of varices or ascites.
Nodular regenerative hyperplasia with minimal fibrosis ruled out cirrhosis.
Parakeratotic squamous mucosa with underlying lichenoid inflammation, no evidence of dysplasia.
Normocellular marrow with adequate megakaryocytes, mildly increased myeloid-to-erythroid ratio, no evidence of lymphoma or dysplasia.
945 CD3+ T cells per cubic millimeter (normal range: 1000 to 2200); normal absolute numbers of CD4+, CD8+, CD19+ B cells and natural killer cells.
